Since this is a docker image, all information is included in your dockerfile, or they are host machine env not affecting container. Considered that situation, I left those fields blank.

To reproduce:
Install CUDA and cuDNN
Install nvidia-docker
nvidia-docker run -d --name tftest tensorflow/tensorflow:latest-gpu-py3
docker exec -ti tftest python3
import tensorflow

It throws libcuda.so.1 not found error. The reason and fix is provided above. Thanks.

To reproduce:
Install CUDA and cuDNN
Install nvidia-docker
`nvidia-docker run -d --name tftest  tensorflow/tensorflow:latest-gpu-py3`
`docker exec -ti tftest python3`
`import tensorflow`
